body_html:
@apaszke Yep make() along with the suite of initialize_ methods will definitely disappear step by step (trying to gradually change it so I can update tests + StarCraft). The goal is to morph these classes into what I had in #6345 essentially.

I'm putting all .cpp files into src and header files into include. I think in terms of distribution, we wouldn't necessarily ship these files with our Python distro, but rather folks would submodule PyTorch and add_subdirectory() it to compile it into a library, like we do for ATen.
body_text:
@apaszke Yep make() along with the suite of initialize_ methods will definitely disappear step by step (trying to gradually change it so I can update tests + StarCraft). The goal is to morph these classes into what I had in #6345 essentially.
I'm putting all .cpp files into src and header files into include. I think in terms of distribution, we wouldn't necessarily ship these files with our Python distro, but rather folks would submodule PyTorch and add_subdirectory() it to compile it into a library, like we do for ATen.
body:
@apaszke Yep `make()` along with the suite of `initialize_` methods will definitely disappear step by step (trying to gradually change it so I can update tests + StarCraft). The goal is to morph these classes into what I had in #6345 essentially.

I'm putting all `.cpp` files into `src` and header files into `include`. I think in terms of distribution, we wouldn't necessarily ship these files with our Python distro, but rather folks would `submodule` PyTorch and `add_subdirectory()` it to compile it into a library, like we do for ATen.
